subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Islamophobia: Fear and Misunderstanding
description: A micro-lesson that makes Islamophobia: Fear and Misunderstanding usable.

hook.text: 1.8 billion Muslims in the world. Most Westerners only see the violent fringe. Islamophobia fills the gap with fear.

buildup.text: After 9/11, hate crimes against Muslims surged. Media coverage linked Islam with terrorism in the public imagination.

discovery.text: Studies show most people who fear Islam have never met a Muslim. Ignorance, not experience, drives prejudice.

twist.text: Islamophobia hurts non-Muslims too. Sikhs, Hindus, and Arabs face attacks from people who can't tell religions apart.

climax.text: Fighting Islamophobia requires education, not just tolerance. Understanding Islam is a civic duty in a diverse world.

punchline.text: Fear fills gaps left by ignorance. Education is the real antidote.

quiz.question: What drives Islamophobia according to research?
options: Ignorance and lack of contact with Muslims
